H0.text: Pulley is a simple machine that consists of a rope and grooved wheel.

H1.text: Axle is the term for a simple machine that consists of a rope and a grooved wheel.

H2.text: Lever is the simple machine that consists of a rope and a grooved wheel.

H3.text: Pedal is a simple machine that consists of a rope and a grooved wheel.

A4.text: A pulley is a wheel on an axle or shaft enabling a taut cable or belt passing over the wheel to move and change direction, or transfer power between itself and a shaft. A pulley may have a groove or grooves between flanges around its circumference to locate the cable or belt.

A5.text: This system is included in the list of simple machines identified by Renaissance scientists.
